Student’s t-distribution, or simply the t-distribution, is a bell-shaped probability
distribution that is symmetrical about its mean. It is the appropriate distribution to use
when constructing confidence intervals based on small samples (n < 30) from populations
with unknown variance and a normal, or approximately normal, distribution. It may
also be appropriate to use the t-distribution when the population variance is unknown
and the sample size is large enough that the central limit theorem will assure that the
sampling distribution is approximately normal.
